name: Two-photon calcium imaging of mouse PPC/PM during auditory virtual navigation (Funamizu et al. 2016)
citation: Taniguchi, Masachika (2025) Two-photon calcium imaging of mouse PPC/PM during auditory virtual navigation (Funamizu et al. 2016) (Version draft) [Data set]. DANDI Archive. https://dandiarchive.org/dandiset/001605/draft
description: This Dandiset contains session-wise NWB files converted from legacy MATLAB data for in vivo two-photon calcium imaging in head-fixed mice navigating a virtual corridor guided by auditory cues. Imaging targeted posterior parietal cortex (PPC) and adjacent posteromedial cortex (PM) across layers 2/3 and 5 while animals ran on a spherical treadmill in darkness with continuous or intermittent sound feedback. The dataset includes segmented ROI masks and population activity (raw ratio and ΔF/F) as RoiResponseSeries, together with aligned behavioral signals (locomotion/position, forward–lateral speed, lick rate, sound on/off indicators, and reward events) stored under the behavior module. Sampling is uniform at ~30.9 Hz for imaging and behavior, enabling trial-level analyses of neural dynamics during goal-directed navigation. These data support investigations of multisensory integration and predictive coding in posterior cortical areas and are closely related to the study by Funamizu, Kuhn & Doya (Nature Neuroscience, 2016), which reported PPC/PM representations consistent with dynamic Bayesian inference during an auditory virtual-reality task (doi:10.1038/nn.4390). Please cite that article when using this dataset.
